question:
In context with the launch of the Nishtha scheme in Jammu and Kashmir, consider the following statements:
  1. It is an initiative of human resource and development ministry.
  2. It is a teachers’ training program.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: NISHTHA is a scheme that was launched by the ministry of human resource and development/ MHRD. It is aimed at improving learning outcome at elementary level. A dedicated mobile app was also released by the ministry this year. This scheme has now been launched in the newly created UT. Statement 2 is correct: NISHTA is a teachers’ training scheme. It stands for National Initiative for School Heads and Teachers Holistic Advancement. It involves the use of resource persons who will be trained at national level and will use cascade mechanism to train more locally sourced resource persons.
